docs.title: Technical Note
docs.text: I use this technical note to accumulate all the knowledge I have obtained when working on different projects.

docs.title: 1.1. Python
docs.text: Life is short, and please use Python!

docs.title: 1.2. Markdown
docs.text: Markdown's goal is to allow people “to write using an easy-to-read, easy-to-write plain text format, and optionally convert it to structurally valid XHTML (or HTML).”

docs.title: 1.3 CUDA
docs.text: CUDA (Compute Unified Device Architecture) is NVIDIA's parallel computing platform and programming model that lets developers use Graphics Processing Units (GPUs) for general-purpose processing.

docs.title: 1.4 CMake
docs.text: CMake is cross-platform free and open-source software for build automation, testing, packaging and installation of software by using a compiler-independent method.

docs.title: 2.1 Linux
docs.text: The first step in becoming a data scientist: forget about Windows.

docs.title: 2.2 Windows
docs.text: Windows is a computer operating system (OS) developed by Microsoft Corporation

docs.title: 2.3 Docker
docs.text: Docker is an open platform for developing, shipping, and running applications.

docs.title: 2.4 Popular Apps
docs.text: Popular Apps include web browsing, office suites, media, creative work, productivity, and system tools.

docs.title: 3.1 Version Control
docs.text: Version control is used to track and manage changes to files, especially code, over time.

docs.title: 3.2 Design Pattern
docs.text: A software design pattern or design pattern is a general, reusable solution to a commonly occurring problem in many contexts in software design.

docs.title: 4.1 Data
docs.text: Data is the new oil.

docs.title: 4.2 Mlops
docs.text: MLOps stands for Machine Learning Operations. MLOps is a core function of Machine Learning engineering, focused on streamlining the process of taking machine learning models to production, and then maintaining and monitoring them.

docs.title: 4.3 Model
docs.text: A machine learning model is a file that has been trained to recognize certain types of patterns.

docs.title: 5.1 3D Sensing
docs.text: 3D sensing is a depth-sensing technology that augments camera capabilities for facial and object recognition. The process of capturing a real-world object's length, width, and height with more clarity and in-depth detail than can be achieved using a number of different technologies.

docs.title: 5.2 Sensor Fusion
docs.text: Sensor fusion integrates data from various sensors to enable smarter decision-making by computer systems.

docs.title: 6.1 Image Construction
docs.text: Image construction refers to the computational process of generating images from raw data collected by sensors.

docs.title: 6.2 Image Quality Assessment
docs.text: Image quality assessment refers to the methods used to measure and evaluate the perceived quality of digital images,

docs.title: 7.1 Projective Distortion Correction
docs.text: Projective distortion correction is the process of digitally manipulating an image to remove the geometric distortions caused when a 3D scene is projected onto a 2D image plane from an angled viewpoint.

docs.title: 7.2 SLAM
docs.text: SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping) is a fundamental technology that enables an autonomous system (like a robot or drone) to build a map of an unknown environment while simultaneously determining its own precise location within that map in real-time.

docs.title: 8.1 Texture Analysis
docs.text: Texture analysis in image processing is the process of quantifying and characterizing the spatial arrangement and variation of pixel intensities within a digital image.

docs.title: 8.2 Image Segmentation
docs.text: Image segmentation is a core computer vision technique that involves partitioning a digital image into multiple segments, or groups of pixels, to simplify its representation and make it easier to analyze.

docs.title: 8.3 Object Detection
docs.text: Object detection is a computer vision technique that allows us to identify and locate objects in an image or video.

docs.title: 9.1 Hand Pose Estimation
docs.text: Posture estimation is used to understand human's behavior.

docs.title: 9.2 Object Tracking
docs.text: Video object tracking is a key computer vision task that involves locating a moving object (or multiple objects) over time in a sequence of video frames.

docs.title: 10.1 English
docs.text: English is everywhere.

docs.title: 10.2 French
docs.text: C'est belly langue.

docs.title: 10.3 Poems
docs.text: Poetry is a form of literary art that uses the aesthetic and often rhythmic qualities of language to evoke meanings and emotions beyond literal definitions.

docs.title: 10.4 Cooking
docs.text: I like cooking for my families.

docs.title: 10.5 Health
docs.text: Health is everything.

docs.title: Mkdocs
docs.text: • How to Generate Mkdocs on Github Using Docker
